regarding grading for students in kindergarten through grade 11 was was delivered by
Superintendent Gainey to RCSS parents and staff members on April 23, 2020.

During school closures, RCSS School Nutrition Services continues to provide one breakfast and one lunch per day for children 18 years of age and younger. Beginning April 27, families will be able to pick up breakfast and lunch at the same time.

To view other calendars and schedules, including our main school calendar, Board of Education meeting dates, school cultural arts performances, athletic schedules, and more, please go to the "Calendars" link at the top of this page.

div.span: The Randolph County School System does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, or age in its programs and activities and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts, Girl Scouts, and other youth support groups as provided by law. The following people have been designated to handle inquiries regarding the non-discrimination policies: Marty Trotter, Title IX Coordinator, and Edwina Ashworth, Section 504 Coordinator, 2222-C South Fayetteville St. Asheboro, NC 27205 Phone: 336-633-5000.

br.span: The Randolph County School System is committed to ensuring that all web users can access its web content. If you have difficulty accessing information on our website due to a disability, please contact us at

span.span: and provide the URL (web address) of the material

br.span: you tried to access, the problem you experienced, and your contact
